selected_quotes: #AML now defined by specific molecular/cytogenetic changes. How are they best tx'd today?
Toward Individualized Therapy in Acute Myeloid #Leukemia (#AML) @LeukemiaMDA
Review on how #AML are now defined by molecular/cytogenetic changes and how they are best treated today

citation.abstract: Acute myeloid leukemia (AML) is a heterogeneous disease in its clinical presentation, response to therapy, and overall prognosis. For decades, pretreatment karyotype evaluation has served to identify subgroups for risk-adapted postremission therapy, but the initial treatment approach has been largely unchanged. With continued advances in the genetic and epigenetic characterization of AML, we have discovered even more diversity and are starting to understand the biological underpinnings of these multiple disease entities. Newer therapies are being developed to address the pathophysiology within these individual AML subsets. This review categorizes AML into biologically defined groups based on currently available data and describes the evolving treatment approaches within these groups. Identifying the genetic abnormalities and biological drivers prior to AML treatment will be important as we work to individualize therapy and improve outcomes.
citation.title: Toward Individualized Therapy in Acute Myeloid Leukemia: A Contemporary Review

facebook.title: Timeline Photos
facebook.summary: As we gain further insight into its biology, acute myeloid leukemia (AML) appears to be a highly heterogeneous group of diseases with different drivers and different vulnerabilities. The challenge going forward is to identify these differences and develop
